TopicTitle: IIS astronaut uses plastic ruler to gauge cargo ship speed

Just sharing this because I feel a lotÃ¢â‚¬â€¹ better about my KSP playing knowing this.
That is a bit surprising. I hope NASA isn't using plastic protractors for determining rocket altitudes as well.
It's normal. In fact, the Russian Sokol pressure suits are manually tied (yes, as in a hand-tied knot) to make them airtight. The more you learn...

It's a manual check, to be sure the computer is doing what is expected. If you have it done by a computer, it's not a manual check anymore, and you're trusting a computer to do what's is supposed to do.

Simple solutions are a good thing, and I'm sure there's a lot of super low tech stuff used in space applications, because they're reliable.
